Description.Name: Magpie's Stash
Description.Details:
You asked to be notified when we got to the coordinates? Turns out there's a supply pod tethered to an asteroid.

And it’s covered in hazardous material warnings.

Do you want to open it?

Description.Name: Send Magpie out to open the pod.
Description.Details:
You look at [[TGT_MW,{TGT_MW.Callsign}]]. "What’s in this pod? "Magpie frowns and leans over to check the sensor readings. "Honestly Commander, your guess is as good as mine. I never asked what my clients were hiding away and I don't plan on asking now."

 Darius starts to frown and starts paging through the sensors readings. "I’m not sure what to make of it Commander. Sensors are picking up what could be an inactive Fusion Core. The pod doesn't look dangerous but I'd recommend opening it outside. Just in case anything happens."

Magpie nods in agreement. "It's probably the safest course of action. My client liked to hide stuff in the middle of nowhere for good reason. It's probably safe, but I wouldn't want to bet on it."

The Argo backs off and Magpie approaches the pod in an EVA suit.

Description.Name: Refuse to open the pod.
Description.Details:
You look at [[TGT_MW,{TGT_MW.Callsign}]]. "What's in this pod? "Magpie frowns and leans over to check the sensor readings. "Honestly Commander, your guess is as good as mine. I never asked what my clients were hiding away and I don't plan on asking now."

 Darius starts to frown and starts paging through the sensors readings, visibly agitated."Commander, you have to get us out of here now, some lunatic booby trapped this pod. Sensors are picking up a live Fusion reaction. I think some crazy bastard wired up a Fusion Core as an improvised nuke."

Magpie looks startled and alarmed."It's certainly possible, my clients were dangerous people. I only supplied the pod and the coordinates. What they did with it was never my concern." 

Magpie continues,"I certainly have no plans to end up as a smear of mildly exciting debris out in the ass end of nowhere. I have a little cash left, let me arrange to have that transferred to you instead. It’s not much but it's better than nothing."

You give the order to abort approach much to the crews relief.
